title: Are you kidding me?
text: Now this app has started not telling us how busy a place will be? That’s not going to make me say “eff it” and go out with my wallet, it’s going to inspire me to assume the worst and hunker down. Stop shooting yourself in the junk, Google Maps. You have the potential to be the best navigation app now that VZ Navigator’s throne is empty. Just do that, and skip all the annoying attacks on the user.

title: Please fix the automatic zoom in
text:
Please disable the automatic zoom-in when switching between alternative routes while in navigation mode. This is so annoying when trying to switch to alternative route while driving, I need to verify the selected route is correct before committing to it. 

This issue is only present in IOS devices. Androids don’t have this problem.

title: Can anyone read a map‽
text:
Outlining the region I searched for is great but I'd like to decide when to dismiss it. It's frustrating to zoom in to see borders but watch it fade. 
Same thing with font. How do I zoom in to read names but not have the font stay the same size? -- I hate the advertising all over my map. I don't shop at the Wade-in-McHina store, nor do I eat at McIcky's so I have no need to know where they are. I spent (wasted?) time awhile ago trying to eliminate useless categories without success but would love to see that change. 

I kinda feel sorry for people who do stupid things when using Google *Maps* … or do I? Here’s how to help protect yourself from time wasting mistakes (like e.g. driving into an apartment complex while trying to go to a restaurant) and help yourself long term. Get your route and stop there. No directions, at least no audio. Now you'll talk yourself through the route to your destination. If you're uncertain about cardinal directions use left, right, u-turn, etc. I often use both. Narrate the route to yourself *out loud* ※:  
❝*Pull out on 38th St, turn right (south) Get in the left lane when it's convenient *Drive 7 blocks(1mi) to Navajo Ave, turn left (east) Continue east for 2 miles past the edge of town, past Foxvale. The compost pickup is on your right (south) *If you get to 2 schools you've gone too far.❞  
Don't panic if you make a mistake- just pull over and reorient yourself. You won't have that awful voice nor do your passengers *and* you’ll gain map knowledge rather than barely functional route knowledge so you’ll actually know where you are. Putting yourself in the middle of the map won’t help you understand what direction you’re facing. 

Some of the "I hate what happened with the update" complaints aren't hard to prevent: turn off automatic updates. (Reset it in Settings.) I don't bother with updates for watch, for example, because I don't have one and it may have introduced a bug. New versions of iOS have to prove themselves after I was burned awhile back.

※ Speaking the directions engages motor and audio processing so it should help with your understanding and recall.

title: Getting worst!!!
text:
Get rid of that useless /annoying "you're on the fastest route available "!!!! It serves no purpose, and it adds to the distraction. Also lately it shows out of the blue different itineraries . I was driving on interstate 85 from NC to GA . I was driving at night and there was no traffic . Google maps was giving me options to leave the interstate and go on a freakin triangle for absolutely no reason . I understand if it was traffic or road construction .

Update :02/29/2024 I went from 5 stars to 3 to 1. Google is getting dumber by the day . 
Another annoying thing is it sends me notifications to rate this restaurant that I already rated 2 years ago . I rated it 5 stars and I even posted pictures . I moved to Colorado since then. Two years later for some weird reason keeps popping on my screen to rate it AGAIN . Here in Colorado when I choose directions to go to the airport and I avoid tolls , it changes automatically without even letting you know and sends you to the toll route . It’s almost seems like Google is getting paid by the toll authority to do that . 
Thank God for Apple Maps that are way better nowadays . I started using Google maps less and less . The only thing I hate about Apple Maps is they incorporated Yelp for reviews …and Yelp is the worst app ever!

title: First use
text: I used Google maps for the first time for navigation. I really like the stay on display. I think it’s time to combine the app with Waze.

title: Couldn’t tell me how many miles I’d be walking
text: Opened my google maps app to to get a rough estimate for how many miles I’d be walking today, and found out after a lot of poking around that it just wasn’t possible on the app, but it was on the website version. I had to delete the google maps app to even be able to pull up the website version and then I was able to get the rough estimate on the miles I’d be walking. For an app that supports walking directions it was incredibly stupid not to have that as a feature. The Google maps app will not be downloaded again. Consider this a breakup google. 💔

title: Used to think Google maps was great.
text: I depended on google maps every time I needed to know how to get somewhere. Recently I was traveling toward Shreveport Airport and google maps led me to a casino in the downtown area away from the airport, then directed from the casino to the airport. This route was no way the fastest and safest route. It required a U turn between fast moving traffic and another to get back on a freeway I had already been on. Either google maps was paid to take me by the Casino or the app was hijacked by the casino. Either way it was a disappointment to be lead away from the airport. Luckily I had left extremely early so I could return the rental car and make my flight. Otherwise I could have missed my flight being taken somewhere I didn’t ask to go.

title: Major bug in new update
text: Major bug in new version of Google Maps. When using Google Maps for driving navigation, it now gives us brand new lock screen notifications of our upcoming turns in a big black banner that appears on our Lock Screen. However, if you tap on the black box to open up the Google Maps App, Google Maps asks you if you want to EXIT from your navigation! What the —? No, we don’t want to exit from our navigation. We are trying to see the app!

title: Inaccurate titles
text: This is the Map of the world, not Google’s. The fact that this company decided to change the name of the Persian Gulf to some made-up name without any explanation and just due to political pressure is just unacceptable.

title: Google maps avoids highways
text: I don’t know why Google maps takes you around to every place to avoid a highway but it does. It will make you do a U-turn right when you are at the highway and make you go through developments on a longer route instead of taking the highway. The app is marked correctly to where it’s not telling the app to avoid the highways, but the app does what it wants and continues to get worse. I am at interstate 55 and it wants me to turn around and go back from where I came through developments in order to get to my destination, which is right off the interstate. this is unsatisfactory and seems to be happening to a lot of people.
